controller

Class MessageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MessageController

  • public class MessageController
extends java.lang.Object
    The MessageController class controls what messaging options a User has depending on the type of User

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor for MessageController, initializes an MessageController object

      Sends a mass message to all Attendees, all Speakers, all Organizers, or Everyone Speaker exclusive
      void messageOptions()
      Reads the user input for options 0 to exit 1 to send messages 2 to view inbox 3 to view sent messages

      Sends a direct message to a desired list of users The recipients must be contacted with the sender

      Sends a message to the Attendees of a event that the Speaker is hosting The event must have an Attendee(s) and the Speaker must be speaking at that event Speaker exclusive
      void sendMessageToAttendeesAllEvent(java.lang.String speakerUsername, java.lang.String message)
      Sends a message to the Attendees of all events that the Speaker is hosting Speaker exclusive

      • MessageController

        public MessageController(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,IManager> managers,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,IPresenter> presenters,
                         java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String userType)
        Constructor for MessageController, initializes an MessageController object
        Parameters:
        managers - HashMap of String keys that map to IManager objects (Managers)
        presenters - HashMap of String keys that map to IPresenter objects (Presenters)
        username - String representing the User's username
        userType - String representing the User's type (Attendee, Organizer, etc.)

      • messageOptions

        public void messageOptions()
        Reads the user input for options 0 to exit 1 to send messages 2 to view inbox 3 to view sent messages

      • msgSend

        public void msgSend(java.lang.String senderUsername,
                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> recipientUsernames,
                    java.lang.String message,
                    boolean isRequest)
        Sends a direct message to a desired list of users The recipients must be contacted with the sender
        Parameters:
        senderUsername - The username of the sender.
        recipientUsernames - An Arraylist of recipient usernames.
        message - The message body.
        isRequest - Boolean that tells if the message is a request

      • sendMessageToAttendee

        public void sendMessageToAttendee(java.lang.String speakerUsername,
                                  java.lang.String eventID,
                                  java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message to the Attendees of a event that the Speaker is hosting The event must have an Attendee(s) and the Speaker must be speaking at that event Speaker exclusive
        Parameters:
        speakerUsername - The username of the Speaker sending the message.
        eventID - The eventID that contains attendees to message.
        message - The message body.

      • sendMessageToAttendeesAllEvent

        public void sendMessageToAttendeesAllEvent(java.lang.String speakerUsername,
                                           java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message to the Attendees of all events that the Speaker is hosting Speaker exclusive
        Parameters:
        speakerUsername - The username of the Speaker sending the message.
        message - The message body.

      • massMessage

        public void massMessage(java.lang.String organizerUsername,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Sends a mass message to all Attendees, all Speakers, all Organizers, or Everyone Speaker exclusive
        Parameters:
        organizerUsername - The username of the Organizer sending the message.
        type - The type of user to message, takes: "Attendee", "Speaker", "Organizer", "Everyone".
        message - The message body.
